titleStmt.title: An elegy on the death of Algernon Sidney Esq; who was found guilty of high-treason, and beheaded at Tower-Hill on Friday the 7th of December, 1683.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by George Croom, at the Blew-Ball in Thames-street, over against Baynard's Castle,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Wonder not (reader) if you here descry ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Blew-Ball in Thames-street, over against Baynard's Castle
